snippet: Richard Haste faces charges of charges of first- and second-degree manslaughter in the shooting death of Ramarley Graham, an unarmed 18-year-old.
abstract: Attorney for New York City Police Officer Richard Haste, charged with manslaughter in the Bronx shooting death of unarmed 18-year-old Ramarley Graham, says he had 'no choice' but to shoot the teenager in self-defense, believing he had a weapon; Officer Haste pleads not guilty to the charges of first- and second-degree manslaughter and is released after posting $50,000 bail.

byline.original: By ZENA BARAKAT and RANDY LEONARD

lead_paragraph: Richard Haste faces charges of charges of first- and second-degree manslaughter in the shooting death of Ramarley Graham, an unarmed 18-year-old.

headline.seo: Officer Pleads Not Guilty in Ramarley Graham Shooting
headline.main: Officer Had ‘No Choice’ in Bronx Man’s Shooting, His Lawyer Says in Court
headline.print_headline: Officer Had ‘No Choice’ in Bronx Man’s Shooting, His Lawyer Says in Court
